formattedAddress: 96 South St, New York, NY 10038, USA
adrFormatAddress: 96 South St, New York, NY 10038, USA

authorAttribution.displayName: Lisa Steele l Fresh Eggs Daily

originalText.text:
Really pretty restaurant.  Great service.  But the menu was fairly limited and the food didn't knock our socks off. Cacio e pepe was very cheesy? And the Squash pizza was good, but nothing terribly special. The bread basket with olive oil was good.  And we did enjoy the buttara appetizer. That said,  it's worth a visit just to walk around the farmers market type displays downstairs. We had cookies and a cupcakes for dessert at the bakery downstairs and they were delicious.  The staff is all excellent.  Friendly and helpful. And the venue is beautiful.
Lisa Steele
Author of The Fresh Eggs Daily Cookbook

originalText.text: love love love! the food is sooooo delicious and the service is great..i love this place for the perfect date night! the penne and the chicken parm were really the stars of my order..including the sparkling cranberry cocktail, the ambiance is a highlight too, the food was super fresh and this was my first time dinning in (the first time i tried the food was with takeout) it was very busy but we were seated within 10 mins and were greeted with an attentive and enthusiastic waiter!! 10/10 will be back continuously

text.text: love love love! the food is sooooo delicious and the service is great..i love this place for the perfect date night! the penne and the chicken parm were really the stars of my order..including the sparkling cranberry cocktail, the ambiance is a highlight too, the food was super fresh and this was my first time dinning in (the first time i tried the food was with takeout) it was very busy but we were seated within 10 mins and were greeted with an attentive and enthusiastic waiter!! 10/10 will be back continuously

originalText.text: Absolutely great spot! The tin building is great for a walk around pre dinner and they have a nice bar! Make sure to sit at the bar at the restaurant as you can watch the chefs working away! Really fun vibe and great food - pasta didnt blow us away but the pizza was so lovely and thin! Service was a bit slow the only reason for a 4!

text.text: Absolutely great spot! The tin building is great for a walk around pre dinner and they have a nice bar! Make sure to sit at the bar at the restaurant as you can watch the chefs working away! Really fun vibe and great food - pasta didnt blow us away but the pizza was so lovely and thin! Service was a bit slow the only reason for a 4!

originalText.text: 5 stars all around.  I typically avoid pizza (carbs) but this was absolutely worth it!  Truly my best sit down full pizza in NYC.  We ordered the squash pizza, and the truffle pizza.  YUM.  We also ordered tuna tartare (which sounds so boring!) - delightful!  My cocktail was strong (thank you) & they do an excellent job for ambience when you’re actually in a food hall.  Must come back.

text.text: 5 stars all around.  I typically avoid pizza (carbs) but this was absolutely worth it!  Truly my best sit down full pizza in NYC.  We ordered the squash pizza, and the truffle pizza.  YUM.  We also ordered tuna tartare (which sounds so boring!) - delightful!  My cocktail was strong (thank you) & they do an excellent job for ambience when you’re actually in a food hall.  Must come back.

originalText.text: We were a bit relictabt... an "Italian" restaurant with a "French " reference in the name in the midst of a food"factory" but boy were we happy to have chosen this place! Delicious food, meatball spaghetti was the favorite of our son, the veal.... was THE BEST I ever had in ANY Italian restaurant, even in Italy! The pizzas were tasteful, thin crusted but I wish they would stop charring the side of the crust as it detracts from the taste and deliberately charring it is NOT wat a real Italian would do! A great pizza is less great when such practice is used! But overall is this one of the best places to eat in lower Manhattan!
